page.title: 02LARKHALL TRANSPORT
page.content: LARKHALL TRANSPORT LARKHALL HAS ALWAYS BEEN SITUATED ON THE MAIN GLASGOW TO LONDON ROUTE VIA CARLISLE.PRINCE CHARLES EDWARD STUART AND HIS JACOBITE ARMY PASSED THROUGH LARKHALL ON CHRISTMAS DAY 1746 ON THEIR LONG RETREAT FROM DERBY.IN DECEMBER 1814 THE FAMOUS ROAD ENGINEER THOMAS TELFORD BEGAN THE CONSTRUCTION OF THE GLASGOW TO CARLISLE ROAD WHICH WAS IN USE WITH PERIODIC IMPROVEMENTS UNTIL THE OPENING OF THE MOTORWAY.THE LARKHALL SECTION OF THE ROAD WAS OPENED IN 1820 AND CONTINUED IN USE UNTILL THE MOTORWAY THE M74 WAS OPENED IN 1974.A SURVEY WE CONDUCTED SHOWED THAT 50% OF THE JOURNEYS MADE BY LARKHALL PEOPLE USING THE MOTORWAY ARE LOCAL I.E.THE MAIN DESTINATIONS BEING GLASGOW,HAMILTON AND MOTHERWELL MADE IN THE COURSE OF GOING TO WORK OR SHOPPING.
